subject: Re: JUnit, ANT, log4j, System.out issue
msgSnippet: Well, I discovered a way around the problem, but I am not really clear on why this works. What I did was change the fork attribute on the  and nested
messageBody:
Well, I discovered a way around the problem, but I am not really clear
on why this works.

What I did was change the fork attribute on the <junit> and nested
<batchtest> to "no" from "yes". When these attributes are "no", the
log4j output is captured by the <junit> task in the XML output as
expected. When these attributes are "yes", the log4j output is not
captured, although direct output to System.out is.

I can see where this attribute might effect the output, however, I
would imagine the effect being the opposite. For example, when not
forking a new JVM, I could see where the log4j loaded by JUnit would
be shared with the log4j loaded by ANT and there might be some
interference. When the process is forked however, I do not see how
there would be a negative interaction.

I'd appreciate any enlightment :-)

Thanks,
Ray
